text:
Mawyer, Denise T.

 

Rosthig, Hans
Tuesday, June 18, 2002 9:02 PM
king, Valerio A.

ce: ‘Nelson, Christopher (PMIMC )

Subject: RE: TES- Informed Consent

| saw the IC and assumed it was made from the last Covance IC for the pilot study. We may have to expect that all sites
having their own IRB may come up with slightly different ICs.

Best regards

Hany

Original Message —
From: King, Valerie A.
Sent “Tuesday, une 18, 2002 1:50 AM

 

Subject: TES: Informed Consent
Hans:

Chris Nelson called me this moming with a question about the dratt Informed Gonsent for the TES Mult-Center study
from Covance. Essentially, he is questio ‘we are considering to use a new (Covance's) format for the
Informed Consent. Given the time and input already put into the IC format used with the MDS studies, he is trying to
‘understand our rationale for introducing another IC format.

 

| wasnt sure whether this was based on the IC used in the TES pilot study, nor was | entirely clear on the rationale
{does each CRO have thelr own IC format?), 501 told him | would talk to you and get back with him as soon as
possible.

 

He will review the Covance IC as
‘standpoint of consistency. Please

‘that is what we want, but think he ultimately raises the question from the
me know your thoughits/rationale so that I can get back to him.

 

Thanks,
Valerio

OEPZL2902

summary: Covance is considering to use a new format for the TES Mult-Center study. We may have to expect that all sites having their own IRB may come up with slightly different ICs. Please let me know your thoughits/rationale so that I can get back to him.
